wordpressPost.content:
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 

Your Vagina after 50 ðŸ™„

 

I didn’t know if I should write this post because I have a few people in my family that don’t want to know about my vaginal health!

With that said, they probably don’t read this blog so I’m going to take a chance here and hopefully my son, God bless him if he reads this because for one, when I ask him to fold the clothes in the dryer he takes a pencil and picks up my underwear and carries it to my room ðŸ™„Â and then two, he would totally plug his ears and say “la la, la la” when any subject about his mothers body comes up!

Okay, back to my original reason that I am writing this post is that I’ve had a bit of irritating last couple of months!

One day I’m frolicking in jeans and then bam! I’m unable to wear jeans or anything that touches anything (get where I’m going here?)

Without going into full detail (no diseases or anything like that) just a complete change in my bodies bullshit capacity to change as I age.

How do I know it’s a problem with changing as I age? Well because, when I went to my OBGYN, which I seem to have done more in the last year than in my entire lifetime, she says “oh, when you get older the balance of your vagina changes.”

 

I’m like “Woman, what does that mean?” Â I don’t want my vaginas balance to change! Â I’m trying to stay young, look good and age well. Â The last thing that I need is an unbalanced vagina!

So, I tell her to let’s get it back into balance. Â Afterall, I have a sex hungry husband that balanced or not; I have duties to adhere to. Â I don’t have the leisure in my marriage to wait out or balance out my vagina issues!

I mean really, do younger girls have vagina issues? I don’t hear of them. Â Okay, no one talks about them no matter what our age but still, WTF!

Does a vagina do what the hell it wants? Â It must because it’s not cooperating with me and I’m sitting here in a sexy black dress with no underwear (which I hate) waiting for my husband to go to dinner.

Why no underwear… No, it’s not because after 30 years of marriage I’m going to play some sexy game at dinner (guess what honey? I’m not wearing panties, hell no! I can’t keep up as it is) but, it’s more like. “God I hope he doesn’t notice that I’m not wearing panties so I can rest.” Because mostly, I can’t wear them now!!!

 

Here is what happens to our Vagina as we age

 

Your Vaginal Health Over 50

 

I’m not going to talk about the aestheticsÂ because that’s a whole other story.

As we age we lose the sex hormone, Estrogen. Â Which causes dramatic changes is the appearance and the function of our vagina.

The length and size shrinkÂ and then we lose our lubrication. Â Which then, the vaginal area becomes irritated and with that, the walls become thin and we lose elasticity. Â This can inhibit our sex drives and relationships.

Thankfully there are things that we can do to keep or Vaginas healthy and young!

 

Six Ways To Take Care of Your Vagina After 50!

 

  1. Â Moisturize using moisturizers like Replens and Luvena to eliminate dryness.
  2. Â Seems a bit different but you can use a good organic coconut oil too. Â Just make sure you’re not allergic to it and do a spot test on your forearm before using on your vagina.
  3. Use a low dose of Estrogen Therapy via a pill, cream, or a vaginal ring. Â Just talk to your doctor. Â You can do this two or three times a week. Â If you don’t want a pill, the cream is inserted at night and works amazingly.
  4. Your partner will love this one. Â Stay sexually active as the vagina will go into atrophy if you don’t. Â You know what they say “Use it or lose it.” Â Sex helps the vagina maintain moisture and flexibility.
  5. Do Kegel exercises! Â I do one hundred per day and if you want to avoid having to wear leak guard protection in your later years, this really helps. Â Kegel’s help with avoidingÂ prolapse. Â This happens when organs starting slipping out of place ðŸ˜³
  6. Take a probiotic. Â This really helps keep the good flora active as we age to avoid things like yeast infections, etc.

Doing the steps above are super easy and not time-consuming. Â Both your vagina and your partner will thank you for it.

 

Â If you want to do something really great for yourself, I created a six-step course called “The Rejuvenation Program” Â You can check it out by clicking this link:Â http://www.therejuvenationprogram.com

The Rejuvenation Program
